newsitem.title: USA: U.S. M-2 money supply up $7.1 bln in June 23 week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. M-2 money supply up $7.1 bln in June 23 week.

text.p: U.S. M-2 money supply rose $7.1 billion in the June 23 week to $3,918.4 billion, the Federal Reserve said.
The broader M-3 measure rose $19.0 billion to $5,097.5 billion. M-1 was off $2.7 billion to $1,058.9 billion, the Fed said.
The Fed said the four-week moving average of M-2 was $3,912.3 billion versus $3,910.2 billion in the previous week.
